channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Rubbish dumped, 27th September
item.description:
I pile of rubbish is outside 100 bexley road.eltham Not sure if it's been fly tipped there
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 108, Bexley Road, Avery Hill, Eltham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bridge height sign not replaced, 27th September
item.description:
Reference FixMyStreet 7667791 reported 5th June 2025. The status on this report has been changed to 'Closed'. The sign has not been replaced and is still faded, that much that it cannot be seen easily by approaching traffic. Also a neighbouring tree will start to obscure it. I am the original reporter, the last update before being closed was in July when it said a replacement sign would be installed shortly. See original report for pictures.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Upper Elmers End Road, Upper Elmers End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter and weeds, 27th September
item.description:
Stanmore Terrace hasn't been cleaned or weeded since the last time I reported this issue. Someone did come out and addressed the problem, but non one has been since. I have emailed numerous times to get Stanmore Terrace cleaned and it's only when I've emailed that the issue has been resolved. However, why have you not allocated this street to anyone's round so that it is cleaned regularly. Be be honest, I am sick and tired of emailing to get the street cleaned. Therefore, can you please add this road to be cleaned on a regular basis. Not much to ask.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stanmore Terrace, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large amounts of dumped construction waste, 27th September
item.description:
Large amounts of continuous construction waste next to overflowing rubbish skip on Berners Place, which is attracting rodents. This keeps happening this year and is not being addressed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 10, Berners Street, Fitzrovia, Camden Town, London
Report on FixMyStreet
